subject: Re: [junit] Is Junit-based testing REALLY possible for commercial software development ?
msgSnippet: I can t/don t touch type. (Never tried learning) And I m not saying that touch typing is bad, but I think that it s optimising the wrong thing. Programming is
messageBody:
I can't/don't touch type. (Never tried learning) And I'm not saying
that touch typing is bad, but I think that it's optimising the wrong
thing.

Programming is absolutely not about the typing. It's about explaining
to the computer what you want it to do. I find that it takes more time
to figure out how I'm going to explain what I want using the
language/toolset that I have than it does to hunt and peck the
characters through a keyboard.

Your milage may vary, but mine has consistently divided out as
thinking takes longer than typing.


On 2/10/06, Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> > Programming is NOT about the typing.
>
> Otherwise the very first thing every developer should learn is touch
> typing... ;)
>
> Cheers, Ilja
>
> PS: I find that touch typing actually helps me in software development - not
> because I type faster, but because typing occupies fewer brain cells...
>
>
>
>
